message.content:
{"id": "151938", 
"title": "Bug 151938 - Handle Duplicate javaagent entries more gracefully", 
"description": "Failing that, it would be better to fail and give an error message than emit the bytecode. This issue came up for our automated installer, which adds a javaagent flag to VM startup commands. We are making our scripts more intelligent to avoid this issue, but we are probably not the only people who will hit this issue (e.g., if someone manually edits both setclasspath.bat and catalina.bat to add the flag for a Tomcat instance...)", 
"OB": "The current behavior of the system is emitting the bytecode when encountering duplicate javaagent entries. However, it would be better to fail and provide an error message instead.",
"EB": "The expected behavior is that AspectJ should detect when a javaagent is specified more than once and give a warning, then disable all but one of the agents.",
"SR": "To resolve this issue, AspectJ should be modified to detect duplicate javaagent entries and provide appropriate error handling, such as giving a warning message and disabling all but one of the agents."}

origin.input_prompt:
Your role is a senior software engineer, you are very good at analyzing and writing bug reports.
It is possible that the bug report may lack sufficient details in the OB, EB, and SR sections.  In such cases, your task is to infer the appropriate details based on the context and supplement the bug report to ensure it contains clear and complete OB/EB/SR statements.  Also, improve the wording of these statements for clarity where possible.
To facilitate this process, please provide your responses in JSON format as follows:
{"id": "", "title": "", "description": "", "OB": "", "EB": "", "SR": ""}
origin.input_content:
<BUG REPORT>
{'id': '151938', 'title': 'Bug 151938Handle Duplicate javaagent entries more gracefully', 'description': 'Failing that, it would be better to fail and give an error message than emit the bytecode.This issue came up for our automated installer, which adds a javaagent flag to VM startup commands. We are making our scripts more intelligent to avoid this issue, but we are probably not the only people who will hit this issue (e.g., if someone manually edits both setclasspath.bat and catalina.bat to add the flag for a Tomcat instance...) ', 'OB': '', 'EB': 'Bug 151938Handle Duplicate javaagent entries more gracefully It would be better if AspectJ detected that it was specified more than once and gave a warning then disabled all but one of the agents. ', 'SR': ''}
